resources.string: Tap any fret to select a note. The app detects which chord you\'re building.
Tap Scales to overlay scale patterns on the fretboard.
Use the capo slider to simulate a capo and transpose your chords.
Tap the fretboard to select notes
Same chord, different bass note. Listen to how each inversion has a distinct character.
This chord only has %d voicings. Re-entrant tuning (High-G) limits inversions because the C string (C4) is almost always the lowest pitch. Low-G tuning allows more inversion variety.
In re-entrant tuning (High-G), the C string is almost always the lowest note, so most voicings are root position. Try selecting \"All\" to see available voicings.
Almost — tune up a tiny bit
Almost — tune down a tiny bit
Tuning meter, %1$d cents %2$s, almost in tune
Pitch visualization showing pitch over time
Browse the Chords tab and tap the heart icon on a voicing to save it here.
Delete folder \"%s\"? Voicings in this folder will not be deleted.
No folders yet. Create one below.
Tap + to create your first chord sheet.\nOr import a ChordPro file.
Or use Capo %d with original chords
Use [ChordName] for chords, e.g. Some[C]where over the [Em]rainbow
Tap the chords above to build your progression
Tap each beat to change direction
Tap a step, then pick finger and string below
Announces note name and cents deviation using text-to-speech
Tightens the in-tune zone from ±6 cents to ±2 cents
Highlights the next untuned string automatically
Start listening automatically when the tuner tab is opened
Your all-in-one ukulele companion for chords, scales, music theory, and composition. Free, offline, no ads, no tracking.
Save all your data (favorites, songs, progressions, patterns, settings, and learning progress) to a file, or restore from a backup.
This will merge favorites, songs, progressions, and patterns from the backup file with your existing data. Settings will be replaced with the backup values.\n\nYour existing data will not be deleted.
The tuner needs access to your microphone to listen to your ukulele and detect the pitch of each string.
The tuner cannot work without microphone access. Please enable it in your device\'s app settings.
Test your knowledge of fretboard notes.
What note is at this position?
Identify the interval between two notes.
Identify the chord quality by ear.
What type of chord is this?
Practice scales with guided play-along, quizzes, and ear training.
Structured lessons from fundamentals to advanced harmony.
This will clear all learning progress, quiz scores, streaks, and lesson completion. This cannot be undone.
Complete today\'s challenges to build your skills!
Even 5 minutes of daily practice is better than 1 hour once a week.
Use a metronome when practising chord changes — start slow and build up.
When learning a new chord, play each string individually to check clarity.
Try humming along while strumming to develop your musical ear.
Practice in front of a mirror to check your hand position.
Focus on smooth transitions rather than speed — speed comes with time.
Learn songs you love! Motivation makes practice enjoyable.
Great session! Keep up the daily practice.
Practice switching between two chords in time.
Listen and play the right chords!
Microphone access needed for chord detection
Choose a key and progression, then play along with real-time chord detection.
Earn badges by practicing and learning.
Tap any feature to learn more about how it works.

The interactive fretboard where you tap frets to build chords. The app detects which chord you are playing and shows inversions, intervals, and alternate names. Includes a capo selector and scale overlay for exploring how chords and scales fit together.

A chromatic tuner that uses your device\'s microphone. Displays the detected note, cents deviation on a needle meter, and plain-English guidance (\"Tune Up\", \"In Tune!\"). Tap the string buttons for a reference tone. Supports multiple tunings, A4 calibration, spoken feedback, and precision mode.

A real-time pitch visualisation tool. Shows the detected pitch on a scrolling graph, displays the current note name, and highlights matched chords. Useful for checking intonation while playing melodies or practising bends.

A comprehensive chord library. Pick a root note and chord type to see all playable voicings on the ukulele. Tap a voicing to load it on the explorer fretboard, or long-press to share or add to favorites. Includes an inversion compare mode.
Your saved chord voicings, organised into folders. Tap a voicing to view it on the fretboard, swipe or long-press for options. Use folders to group chords for specific songs or practice sessions.

A personal songbook for writing and storing chord sheets. Type lyrics and insert chords using bracket notation: \"Some[C]where over the [Em]rainbow\". Supports transposing, capo suggestions, auto-scroll, and import/export of ChordPro files.

A simple tool for composing melodies note by note. Tap notes to build a sequence, choose note durations (whole, half, quarter, eighth, sixteenth), add rests, and play back at adjustable BPM. Great for jotting down melodic ideas or exercises.
Browse and create strumming and fingerpicking patterns. Tap the beat indicators to change strum direction (down, up, mute, rest) or assign fingers to strings. Play them back at adjustable tempo.

A library of common chord progressions in every key. Tap any chord to see it in the library. Create your own custom progressions, practise them with the built-in metronome playback, or explore voice leading between chords.
Structured music theory lessons covering notes, intervals, scales, chords, keys, and harmony. Each lesson has key points and a quick-check quiz so you can verify your understanding before moving on.
Test your knowledge of music theory concepts like intervals, chord construction, key signatures, and scale degrees. Includes a Standard mode and a timed Blitz (60 s) mode for extra challenge.

Ear training for musical intervals. Choose visual (fretboard) or audio mode, select ascending, descending, or harmonic presentation, and pick a difficulty level. Identify the interval and build your relative pitch skills.

A timed quiz that challenges you to identify notes on the fretboard. In \"Name It\" mode you see a position and guess the note; in \"Find It\" mode you see a note and tap its location. Difficulty levels limit the fret range.
Listen to a chord and identify its type (major, minor, diminished, etc.). Difficulty levels add more chord qualities. A great way to develop your harmonic ear.

Practice playing scales on the fretboard with three modes: Play Along (guided with optional metronome), Quiz (identify the scale being played), and Ear Training. Supports all scale types, optional looping, and a compact fretboard view.

A dashboard showing your learning statistics: practice time, day streak, lessons completed, and quiz scores for Theory, Intervals, Note Quiz, and Chord Ear Training. Helps you track consistency and improvement over time.

Three fresh challenges generated every day to keep your practice routine varied. Each challenge targets a different skill — chords, scales, ear training, theory, or transitions. Completing them builds consistency.

A guided practice session builder. Choose duration, skill level, and focus areas to generate a step-by-step routine. The app creates a timed sequence of exercises covering warm-up, technique, repertoire, and cool-down.
Visualise how your fingers move between two chords. Pick two chords and see a step-by-step animation of finger movements. Includes a timed practice mode with switch counter and BPM control.
Real-time play-along practice with audio chord detection. Pick a key and progression, then strum along while the app listens and grades your accuracy. Requires microphone permission.
A gallery of milestones to unlock as you use the app. Earn badges for practice streaks, quiz scores, songs created, chords learned, and more. Check back to see your progress.
An educational guide to using a capo on ukulele. Explains what a capo does, shows how it changes pitch, lists common positions, and includes an interactive try-it section with a reference table.

An interactive circle of fifths diagram. Tap any key to see its key signature, relative minor/major, diatonic chords, and closely related keys. A fundamental reference for understanding key relationships.

A reference guide for chord substitution options. Select a root chord and see which chords can replace it and why — relative minor, tritone sub, modal interchange, and more. Each substitution explains the theory behind it.
Select a scale and see all the chords that naturally occur within it. Shows diatonic triads with Roman-numeral analysis. Useful for songwriting and understanding harmony in any key.
A visual map showing every note on the ukulele fretboard. Highlight a specific note to see all its positions. Supports High-G and Low-G tuning. Tap any note to hear it.
A searchable dictionary of music theory and ukulele terms — from arpeggio to voicing. Each entry includes a concise definition and, where helpful, an example.

Configure app-wide preferences: sound (volume, strum delay, direction), display (theme), tuning (High-G, Low-G, Baritone, etc.), tuner (spoken feedback, precision mode, A4 calibration), fretboard (left-handed, fret count), and notifications.
Share any chord as an image. When viewing a chord in the Explorer or Chord Library, tap the share icon to generate a clean chord diagram image that you can send to friends or post on social media.
Tap the expand icon in the Explorer tab to enter a landscape full-screen fretboard. Great for practice sessions where you want maximum fretboard visibility without UI distractions.
Your all-in-one ukulele companion for chords, scales, music theory, and composition.
Chromatic tuner with real-time pitch detection
Comprehensive chord library with every voicing
Full TalkBack and screen reader support
Spoken tuner feedback for hands-free tuning
Works completely offline — no internet needed
No ads, no tracking, no account required
Your data stays on your device
Swipe from the left edge or tap the menu icon to open the navigation drawer.
Reference — Capo Guide, Circle of Fifths, Glossary
You can change these anytime in Settings.

Tap a key to see its signature and chords. Adjacent keys are closely related.

Circle of Fifths diagram. Tap to select a key.

Tip: With a capo on fret %1$d, you play the %2$s shape but it sounds as %3$s. Each fret raises the pitch by one semitone.
Learn how to replace chords with alternatives that create different colors and moods while maintaining harmonic sense.

Start with diatonic substitutions and relative major/minor swaps — they always sound good. Once comfortable, try modal interchange for more color. Save tritone subs and secondary dominants for when you\'re ready to explore jazz harmony.
See which chords are built from any scale.
This scale has too few notes to build standard triads.
Learn every note on the ukulele fretboard.
Tap any note to hear it
Use the highlight filter to find all positions of a note
Fret 12 is the same notes as fret 0 (one octave higher)
Switch to Low-G to see how the G string changes
Tap notes to compose a melody. Press play to hear it.
Tap a note below to start composing
Tip: Keep your finger on the %1$s string — same note in both chords.
Tip: Keep your fingers on the %1$s strings — same note in both chords.
Total path: %1$d frets movement across %2$d transitions
This progression has only one chord.
